newsitem.title: USA: Micrografx Chairman Grayson to resign.
newsitem.headline: Micrografx Chairman Grayson to resign.

text.p: Micrografx Inc said its founder and chairman, J. Paul Grayson, will resign from all company offices January 1 to pursue other business opportunities and his philanthropic interests.
Micrografx said it named Joseph Kupke, who founded the company along with Grayson, interim chairman.
It also named Douglas Richard interim president.
Richard joined the company in April 1996 as vice president of marketing after Micrografx acquired the company he founded, Visual Software.
Micrografx, whose officials could not be reached, added that it is continuing its search for a chief executive.
